H0.text: where did the rulers of the qing dynasty originate. Mongolia

H1.text: where did the rulers of the qing dynasty originate. Tibet

H2.text: where did the rulers of the qing dynasty originate. Xinjiang

H3.text: where did the rulers of the qing dynasty originate. Manchuria

A4.text: The Qing dynasty was founded by the Manchus, a sedentary farming people descended from the Jurchens, who lived in the region now comprising the Chinese provinces of Jilin and Heilongjiang.

A5.text: The early form of the Manchu state was founded by Nurhaci, the chieftain of a minor Jurchen tribe – the Aisin-Gioro – in Jianzhou in the early 17th century.
